definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: Nothing suggests the need for a double-standard.
sentences.chinese: 没有采取双重标准的必要。

sentences.english: China firmly opposes applying double standards on the counter-terrorism issue.
sentences.chinese: 中方坚决反对在反恐问题上采取“双重标准”。

sentences.english: China and US both guilty of double-standards.
sentences.chinese: 中国和美国都有搞双重标准的过错。

sentences.english: Personal complicity and double standards are the nails in the coffin of our ability to lead.
sentences.chinese: 私下同谋和双重标准是领导力的棺材钉。

sentences.english: Doesn’t that seem like a double standard?

sentences.chinese: 可这就是奥威尔双重标准。

sentences.english: But Wexler recently accused the Turkish prime minister of having a double standard.
sentences.chinese: 但是，韦克斯勒最近指责有双重标准的土耳其总理。

sentences.english: The West has a double-standard approach toward human rights.
sentences.chinese: 西方在人权上一贯采取双重标准。

sentences.english: The powerful countries adopt double standards to fix intricate international issues.
sentences.chinese: 强权国家采取不公正的双重标准操作复杂的国际问题。

sentences.english: But there is frustration in Berlin at what are seen as British double-standards.
sentences.chinese: 英国双重标准的玩法确实激怒了德国。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
only the official is allowed to light the fire/Gods may do what cattle may not/quod licet Iovi, non licet bovi
pinyin: zhi3 xu3 zhou1 guan1 fang4 huo3 , bu4 xu3 bai3 xing4 dian3 deng1
related.word: 只许州官放火，不许百姓点灯

definition: to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
